str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From energes; to be active, efficient.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To divide into parts, cut asunder, distribute. From dia and haireomai; to separate, i.e. Distribute.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.
